variants.Description in input context: Familial parkin mutations that either abolish or preserve ligase activity

Material used.Description: ChIP experiments were performed to analyze parkin's interaction with the p53 promoter in fibroblasts and mouse brains.

Readout description.Conclusion: Pathogenic mutations abolish DNA binding and promoter transactivation
Readout description.Result Description: Pathogenic parkin mutations disrupt DNA binding to the p53 promoter and impair transactivation.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein/DNA binding and transactivation levels consistent with wild-type parkin

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in DNA binding or transactivation compared to wild-type parkin

Material used.Description: Overexpression and depletion experiments were conducted in fibroblasts and mouse brains to assess parkin's functional impact on p53.

Readout description.Conclusion: Pathogenic mutations impair parkin's transcriptional regulation of p53
Readout description.Result Description: Depletion of parkin or introduction of pathogenic mutations led to dysregulated p53 activity.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly described in the text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: p53 activity within 80–120% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: p53 activity < 80% or > 120% of wild-type levels
